intro: Thesium brachyphyllum, commonly known as the short-stemmed thesium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. Its leaves are usually narrow and evergreen, and it produces small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white or pale pink. Thesium brachyphyllum is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
